channel.title: Source for learning
channel.description: Hey, what base source would be best for newbie to learn coding runescape privateserver & java. Should be 317, with 317 gameframe :)

item.title: Source for learning
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:22, topic:421561”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=524218.msg3814948#msg3814948 date=1321237001]
Even so… All of this RSPS shit is still just basic Java.
[/quote]Disagree. While most sources used are garbage, the unused frameworks can teach some advanced patterns regarding concurrency and thread overhead because of context switching as seen in the thread-per-client approach. OpenRS has a nice implementation of the NIO Reactor Pattern, while other sources have good implementations of the Ruby and Python scripting language.[/quote]
95% of the owners/“coders” will never learn that(I’m that 95%, unless you can teach me that ;o).

Read full topic

item.title: Source for learning
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:21, topic:421561”]Even so… All of this RSPS shit is still just basic Java.[/quote]Disagree. While most sources used are garbage, the unused frameworks can teach some advanced patterns regarding concurrency and thread overhead because of context switching as seen in the thread-per-client approach. OpenRS has a nice implementation of the NIO Reactor Pattern, while other sources have good implementations of the Ruby and Python scripting language.

Read full topic

Hyperion confuses the balls off me… I’m decent in java, still don’t know how to work it…
[/quote]Haha. The definition of ‘decent in Java’ is relative.[/quote]

item.title: Source for learning
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“itai, post:16, topic:421561”]1. Like Wintercannon said learn basic Java.
2. Start with Hyperion, don’t start with a terrible source because it will only lead to bad habits.[/quote]Hyperion is a great source, my only quarrel with it being used as an introduction to RSPS is it uses the concept of a login server and cache service. This could be overwhelming to new users.

Read full topic

item.title: Source for learning
item.dc:creator: @itai itai
item.description:
@itai wrote:

  1. Like Wintercannon said learn basic Java.
  2. Start with Hyperion, don’t start with a terrible source because it will only lead to bad habits.

Read full topic

item.title: Source for learning
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Learn basic Java, it’s conventions and good practices and then start with RuneSource and learn how it works. Firstly look at the networking, this will help you understand the packet IO. Look at the Player class and some of the variables you can tweak and change. From there you’ll be able to write packet handlers which modifies how players react and manipulate the game environment, allowing you to add features to your emulator.

Read full topic

^Hyperion for a beginner? I would say delta(EWW IMO), or PI(Laggy but good to learn coding), also learn real java, by books and tuts on the internet.

Learned a hella lot from hyperion. PLus if you can use Graham’s systems, they can take you places.
